title: NDP 2026: Morning of the Show
description: NDP morning. A contractor accidentally ran a script that wiped the production database. You have 3 hours before the gates open. The last backup is 6 hours old. Go.

software-engineer.title: Rescue the Database
software-engineer.instruction: The live database just got wiped. You need to restore it before 40,000 people show up expecting a working app. Put the rescue steps in the right order. One wrong move and you lose data permanently.
software-engineer.hint: In a data emergency, stop things getting worse first, then understand the damage, then restore, then verify — never skip straight to fixing.

items.label: Immediately stop all new data from being written so nothing else gets corrupted
Compare the current state against the backup to see exactly what was lost
Restore from the 6-hour-old backup into a test environment first, not live
Replay the record of actions from the last 6 hours to recover the most recent changes
Run checks to confirm everything looks right, then switch the live app over to the restored database

data-scientist.title: Recover the Lost Data
data-scientist.instruction: The wiped database included 6 hours of user activity that marketing needs for their NDP social media campaign. The raw records still exist in a separate system but they're messy and unprocessed. What's your plan?
data-scientist.hint: Something useful delivered in time beats something perfect delivered too late — but think about whether the data is even still relevant.

options.label: Rebuild the full dataset from raw records. Takes 2 hours but gives marketing complete and accurate data for their campaign.
Use a sample of the records to estimate the missing numbers in 30 minutes. Accuracy drops to about 85% but marketing gets something useful in time.
Skip recovery and instead set up better tracking for NDP day itself. The actual show data will be far more valuable than rehearsal week numbers anyway.
Ask marketing to cross-reference their social media numbers with whatever you can pull from the content delivery logs. Not perfect, but fills the gaps by working together.

cloud-engineer.title: Rebuild the Infrastructure
cloud-engineer.instruction: With the database down, you need to bring the whole system back online fast. Drag each piece to the right slot in the recovery plan. Slot 1 is the very first thing to restore, Slots 2 and 3 run at the same time, and Slot 4 is the final check before going live.
cloud-engineer.hint: The thing everything else depends on must come back first. Think about what the app absolutely cannot work without.

items.label: Speed Cache (stores frequent answers to avoid hitting the database)
